WorkItem.Description:
Whenever a conditional format is used within the PHPExcel_Style_NumberFormat, the HTML and PDF output are double escaped, displaying the <span style="color: red"> in the output.

The reason is behind a double escape issue, with a proposed fix in a pull request I've submitted at: https://github.com/PHPOffice/PHPExcel/pull/410

Here's an example test code:

```
$objPHPExcel = new PHPExcel();
$objPHPExcel->setActiveSheetIndex(0);
$objPHPExcel->getActiveSheet()
    ->setCellValue('A1', '-0.5')
    ->setCellValue('A2', '-0.25')
    ->setCellValue('A3', '0.0')
    ->setCellValue('A4', '0.25')
    ->setCellValue('A5', '0.5')
    ->setCellValue('A6', '0.75')
    ->setCellValue('A7', '1.0')
    ->setCellValue('A8', '1.25')
;

$objPHPExcel->getActiveSheet()->getStyle('A1:A8')
    ->getNumberFormat()
    ->setFormatCode('0.00;[Red]-0.00');

$objWriter = PHPExcel_IOFactory::createWriter($objPHPExcel, 'Excel2007');
$objWriter->save('test.xlsx');

$objWriter = PHPExcel_IOFactory::createWriter($objPHPExcel, 'HTML');
$objWriter->save('test.html');
```

Excel output works as expected, but HTML/PDF have escaping problems (the PDF Writer is based on the HTML for this purpose).

I'd also like to make available the cell comments in the HTML/PDF output, could I work on it? Is there any advice/rules to follow?

Thanks,

Guilherme Capil√©
WorkItem.Summary: Formatting issues on HTML/PDF output (when using conditional formatting)
